questions.question: Adult friendships are often harder to form because:
options: Adults are less friendly than children
Life structures like school no longer provide automatic repeated contact
People become incapable of friendship after age 25
Social media has replaced all in-person connection

questions.question: Research on friendship shows that close friendships typically require:
options: Sharing the same political views
Having known each other since childhood
Accumulated hours of quality time together
Similar income levels

questions.question: Moving from acquaintance to friend typically involves:
options: Immediately sharing your deepest secrets
Gradual vulnerability and repeated positive interactions
Sending friend requests on all platforms
Waiting for them to make all the moves

questions.question: Maintaining long-distance friendships requires:
options: Daily communication or it's not a real friendship
Intentional effort and accepting that frequency may decrease
One person doing all the work
Never discussing difficult topics

questions.question: When a friendship becomes one-sided:
options: You should immediately end it
It's always your fault
Having a direct conversation about it is often the healthiest approach
You should never bring it up
